repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:

Whether an option is allowed to be empty isn't well defined and
isn't properly checked.

Solution:

- For non-list string options, explicitly check the option value
  if it is empty.
- Annotate non-list string options that can accept an empty value.
  - Adjust command completion to ignore the empty value.
- Render values in Lua meta files

comment_data.body: This will probably add an empty string to `opt_bh_values`. Is that intended?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -834,7 +836,7 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 'bh',
       cb = 'did_set_bufhidden',
       defaults = { if_true = '' },
-      values = { 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },
+      values = { '', 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },

@@ -834,7 +836,7 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 'bh',
       cb = 'did_set_bufhidden',
       defaults = { if_true = '' },
-      values = { 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },
+      values = { '', 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },

comment_data.body: 👍🏻 being able to unset this option is what originally confused me, since I know it's internal logic doesn't handle it. Same for `'showcmdloc'`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8298,6 +8307,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_splitkeep',
       defaults = { if_true = 'cursor' },
       values = { 'cursor', 'screen', 'topline' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty

comment_data.body: Shall I remove the comment for both those options? Any other options you know if empty is/(is not) allowed?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8298,6 +8307,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_splitkeep',
       defaults = { if_true = 'cursor' },
       values = { 'cursor', 'screen', 'topline' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty

comment_data.body:
> Shall I remove the comment for both those options?

Yeah I think that would be fine. Although I just noticed that Bram explicitly added a comment mentioning an empty value for `'showcmdloc'` when [including](https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ba936f6f4e85cc1408bc3967f9fd7665d948909b#diff-2ac75622dc8cc79283a60ccce6740b5e2dfc72568eadc4030955f7738823b08bR1808) my PR, which in turn was ported by us (should update that comment now I guess). 

Maybe there is some legacy reason for allowing unset opts🤔? Just seems unnecessarily risky to me, and the `'splitkeep'` logic actually becomes ambiguous with an unset value (unlike `'mousemodel'` and `'showcmdloc'`, which safely fall back to a single value).

Vim also explicitly starting testing for some unset values recently, hence the required change to `gen_opt_test.vim` here (zeertzjq usually keeps the original Vim line commented out when changing oldtests).

> Any other options you know if empty is/(is not) allowed?

I think if we make this change we should be consistent and disallow for all options that don't mention it in the help text, which `'mousemodel'` doesn't.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8298,6 +8307,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_splitkeep',
       defaults = { if_true = 'cursor' },
       values = { 'cursor', 'screen', 'topline' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty

comment_data.body:
As you probably noticed, `:let &bg=''` in both Nvim and Vim sets the option to its "default" but does not set the value itself. Very strange. Probably a bug. Not documented. So let's treat it in a "strict" way and not support it.

Same for the other cases: if it's not documented then it's probably an accident.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -311,6 +311,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_background',
       defaults = { if_true = 'dark' },
       values = { 'light', 'dark' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty
+      -- allowed?

comment_data.body:
Not allowed. Because it doesn't have a different behavior than the other values.

Whereas for example `buftype=''` has a (documented), different behavior.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2395,6 +2400,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_eadirection',
       defaults = { if_true = 'both' },
       values = { 'both', 'ver', 'hor' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty
+      -- allowed?

comment_data.body: What about `fileformat`? We have a functional test that explicitly sets it to empty.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2395,6 +2400,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_eadirection',
       defaults = { if_true = 'both' },
       values = { 'both', 'ver', 'hor' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty
+      -- allowed?

comment_data.body: Using Vim 9.1, `:let &fileformat=''` silently behaves as "dos" (though the value is empty string), even though its default is "unix" on my system. That's a pretty cool feature but I think we can drop it :D
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2395,6 +2400,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_eadirection',
       defaults = { if_true = 'both' },
       values = { 'both', 'ver', 'hor' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty
+      -- allowed?

comment_data.body:
> We have a functional test that explicitly sets it to empty.

Let's update the test to assert the new, proper behavior :P
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2395,6 +2400,8 @@ return {
       cb = 'did_set_eadirection',
       defaults = { if_true = 'both' },
       values = { 'both', 'ver', 'hor' },
+      -- TODO(lewis6991): #31944 removed the ability to set to empty. Is empty
+      -- allowed?

comment_data.body: Nit: Is there a reason `''` is at the start here and at the end for other options?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -834,7 +836,7 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 'bh',
       cb = 'did_set_bufhidden',
       defaults = { if_true = '' },
-      values = { 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },
+      values = { '', 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },

comment_data.body: In earlier patches, having empty at the start caused some failures so I added it back after I made changes to C. Empty is also the default value for some of these options.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -834,7 +836,7 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 'bh',
       cb = 'did_set_bufhidden',
       defaults = { if_true = '' },
-      values = { 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },
+      values = { '', 'hide', 'unload', 'delete', 'wipe' },

comment_data.body: Not sure how `'mac'` got in here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5735,7 +5738,7 @@ return {
       abbreviation = 'mousem',
       cb = 'did_set_mousemodel',
       defaults = { if_true = 'popup_setpos' },
-      values = { 'extend', 'popup', 'popup_setpos', 'mac' },

comment_regular_data.body:
The addition of empty strings in `values` may lead to undesired behavior in cmdline completion:
![Screenshot](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b770904b-5544-49a0-b815-31b51371d07c)

Not selecting any entry already leads to a empty string, so there is now an redundant empty menu entry.

title: fix(options): better handling of empty values
